document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Art

66FDBEA89A624085B401078C185B960E.description: compile collections of artwork such as physical artwork, electronic images, sketchbooks, or portfolios for the purposes of self-evaluations or exhibitions.

8E423F065BB44AC58C918BE38B5536B6.description: express ideas found in collections such as real or virtual art museums, galleries, portfolios, or exhibitions using original artworks created by artists or peers; and

6E948A40B5E54864BC27B509AF3B71F6.description: express ideas about personal artworks or portfolios;

5087413B5626444EAB92C44F63CDECAF.description: The student responds to and analyzes artworks of self and others, contributing to the development of lifelong skills of making informed judgments and reasoned evaluations. The student is expected to:

16299AD476A84F1F83CF194C800393A6.description: relate visual art concepts to other disciplines.

7B1F4C4FC8FA47CC9FDFC3E7DD20AA4D.description: identify the uses of art in everyday life; and

4B08446FAB574C2DA26D6AE28A524C5F.description: share ideas about personal experiences such as family and friends and develop awareness and sensitivity to differing experiences and opinions through artwork;

A87CA9B740DB40568B8238755AFDF932.description: identify simple subjects expressed in artworks;

287F4534C5FE4DD7BFD45C6865F2CBC4.description: The student demonstrates an understanding of art history and culture by analyzing artistic styles, historical periods, and a variety of cultures. The student develops global awareness and respect for the traditions and contributions of diverse cultures. The student is expected to:

799A93C40F674C2299B2029808155643.description: use a variety of materials to develop manipulative skills while engaging in opportunities for exploration through drawing, painting, printmaking, constructing artworks, and sculpting, including modeled forms.

B31CB48B78184F7E9970AC5D81CEBBAF.description: arrange components intuitively to create artworks; and

22CB761499674BA3928F439C408FD51D.description: create artworks using a variety of lines, shapes, colors, textures, and forms;

138451FA38C54395B5997DDB130B6326.description: The student communicates ideas through original artworks using a variety of media with appropriate skills. The student expresses thoughts and ideas creatively while challenging the imagination, fostering reflective thinking, and developing disciplined effort and progressive problem-solving skills. The student is expected to:

E71A3D585492453E9F8BB77428DA9031.description: identify the elements of art, including line, shape, color, texture, and form, and the principles of design, including repetition/pattern and balance, in the environment.

BA56BD50BA98489585D9BA381011A65E.description: gather information from subjects in the environment using the senses; and

068090C640174606934B3545988333A2.description: The student develops and expands visual literacy skills using critical thinking, imagination, and the senses to observe and explore the world by learning about, understanding, and applying the elements of art, principles of design, and expressive qualities. The student uses what the student sees, knows, and has experienced as sources for examining, understanding, and creating artworks. The student is expected to:
